predictions.text: At least one U.S. grid operator in {PJM, MISO, SPP, ERCOT} will declare a NERC Energy Emergency Alert (EEA) level 2 or level 3 due to winter-storm-related generation/fuel constraints, by 2026-01-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: An official grid-operator notice/press release (or NERC event log) explicitly stating EEA level 2 or 3 declared by PJM, MISO, SPP, or ERCOT within the deadline.
evidence: NYT reports a major U.S. winter storm threatening power grids and causing widespread disruption.
MarketWatch notes natural-gas prices surging ahead of the storm, increasing risk of fuel-delivery and price-driven generation constraints.
monitoring_signals: PJM/MISO/SPP/ ERCOT emergency communications pages and X feeds
NERC EEA event reporting / DOE OE-417 or situational awareness updates
Regional spot power and gas basis blowouts; pipeline OFOs/critical notices
predictions.rationale: Large multi-region winter storms often trigger reliability alerts; fuel constraints and high gas prices raise the chance of an EEA declaration.

predictions.text: FlightAware will record at least 20,000 canceled U.S. flights in a single rolling 7-day window between 2026-01-24 and 2026-02-15 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: FlightAware (or an equivalent widely cited aviation-tracking source) publishes/ is cited for total U.S. flight cancellations >=20,000 over any consecutive 7 days fully within 2026-01-24..2026-02-15.
evidence: NYT describes mass flight cancellations tied to the winter storm and large-scale travel disruption risk.
monitoring_signals: FlightAware daily cancellation totals and weekly rollups
Major airline operational updates and DOT incident summaries
Airport ground-stop programs and FAA ATCSCC advisories
predictions.rationale: Severe winter storms frequently create multi-day cascading cancellations; the threshold is high but plausible given nationwide impacts.

predictions.text: USD/JPY will experience at least one day with an intraday high-low range of 3.0 yen or more, by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Any trading day before the deadline where widely used market data (e.g., Refinitiv/Bloomberg quotes as reported by major financial media) show USD/JPY daily high minus daily low >= 3.0.
evidence: MarketWatch highlights a sudden yen spike and elevated FX volatility tied to shifting rate expectations and positioning.
monitoring_signals: Daily USD/JPY high-low ranges; implied FX volatility (1W/1M)
BOJ/Fed communications and surprise data (CPI/jobs) days
Japanese MoF/BoJ intervention rhetoric and positioning indicators
predictions.rationale: Positioning-driven yen moves plus sensitive rate expectations make a 3-yen daily range plausible within a volatile quarter.

predictions.text: The U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics will report CPI (seasonally adjusted) 'Energy' index month-over-month change >= +1.0% in at least one release, by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: A BLS CPI release (Feb or Mar 2026 data release dates within the window) shows the SA Energy index m/m change >= +1.0%.
evidence: MarketWatch reports U.S. natural-gas prices surging ahead of the storm, increasing heating-cost pressure.
NYT notes storm-driven disruptions that can feed into near-term energy prices.
monitoring_signals: EIA weekly natural gas and gasoline price indicators
Heating degree days vs normal; regional utility rate adjustments
WTI/RBOB and Henry Hub price moves feeding into CPI components
predictions.rationale: Weather-driven gas spikes and potential knock-on effects to electricity/heating can show up as a sharp monthly move in CPI energy.

predictions.text: The U.S. Senate Banking Committee will hold a markup and vote to report out a standalone stablecoin-issuer federal framework bill (licensing/supervision + reserve requirements), by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Official Senate Banking Committee schedule/results show a markup and recorded vote (voice or roll call) to report a stablecoin framework bill to the full Senate before the deadline.
evidence: NYT notes Senate momentum on a crypto bill and shifting enforcement/regulatory posture.
monitoring_signals: Senate Banking Committee hearing/markup calendars and press releases
Bill text releases and bipartisan sponsor announcements
Statements from Treasury/FDIC/OCC/Fed on stablecoin policy
predictions.rationale: Momentum exists, but committee scheduling and cross-jurisdiction conflicts make passage from committee uncertain by mid-2026.

predictions.text: The U.S. Department of Commerce (BIS) will publish a new or revised export-controls rule that tightens restrictions on shipments of advanced AI chips to China, explicitly referencing Nvidia by name or explicitly creating new performance thresholds that would cover an Nvidia China-market accelerator, by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: A Federal Register notice (or BIS press release) before the deadline that (a) modifies the relevant ECCNs/controls and (b) explicitly names Nvidia in scope or introduces thresholds that BIS/official guidance states cover a specific Nvidia China-focused accelerator.
evidence: CNBC reports Nvidia CEO’s China visit amid stalled AI chip sales under restrictions, highlighting policy pressure points.
monitoring_signals: Federal Register BIS rulemaking and interim final rules
Commerce/NSC statements on China tech controls
Nvidia 10-Q risk factor updates and China-revenue commentary
predictions.rationale: If policy makers judge existing curbs insufficient or circumvention rising, BIS often tightens thresholds or clarifies scope within months.

predictions.text: Databricks will publicly file an S-1 registration statement for a U.S. IPO (not just media speculation), by 2026-09-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: An S-1 appears on the SEC EDGAR system for Databricks, Inc. (or clearly identified Databricks IPO entity) on or before the deadline.
evidence: CNBC reports Databricks raised $1.8B additional debt ahead of IPO, indicating preparation for public markets.
monitoring_signals: SEC EDGAR new filings; IPO calendar updates from major banks
Databricks hiring for SOX/SEC reporting roles; auditor/underwriter disclosures
Credit agreement amendments referencing IPO or liquidity events
predictions.rationale: The reported pre-IPO debt raise suggests active IPO prep; timing depends on market windows and internal readiness.

predictions.text: At least one publicly traded U.S. business development company (BDC) with market cap >= $5B will report non-accrual investments of at least 3.0% of portfolio at fair value in a quarterly filing, by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: A 10-Q/10-K (or investor presentation) for an eligible BDC discloses non-accruals >=3.0% of portfolio at fair value, dated and filed by the deadline.
evidence: CNBC reports rising private credit stress risk, suggesting higher defaults and spillovers to leveraged borrowers.
monitoring_signals: BDC quarterly earnings releases and portfolio credit tables
Spreads and default rates in leveraged loans/high yield
CRE delinquency metrics and refinancing stress indicators
predictions.rationale: If private-credit stress increases, some large BDCs may show a visible rise in non-accruals, but dispersion and workout timing add uncertainty.

predictions.text: The U.S. Treasury (OFAC) will announce new sanctions targeting Iran-linked oil export facilitation (entities and/or vessels), totaling at least 10 newly designated targets in a single action, by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: OFAC press release and SDN list update shows >=10 new designations in one sanctions action explicitly tied to Iran’s petroleum/petrochemical export network or shipping facilitation, dated by the deadline.
evidence: CNBC notes rising U.S.-Iran tensions and market sensitivity to Strait-of-Hormuz disruption risk.
monitoring_signals: OFAC press releases and SDN update bulletins
U.S. Navy/CENTCOM announcements and escalation events
Insurance/shipping advisories and tanker-tracking anomaly reports
predictions.rationale: Escalation periods often bring sanctions bursts aimed at maritime networks; the 10-target threshold matches typical multi-entity packages.
